content: Just try explaining the basics: knowing the domain name of the account often helps, such as Gmail, Outlook, etc. Seeing a screenshot of the error message and screen can often be a big help. In general, select new account>email and on next panel enter your name and email address - and I suggest NOT entering password yet. and let us know what happens.
creator: davidsk

content:
- go to TB menu > Settings > Appearance > Message List and select Table View if it isn't already

- click the Date header on the Message List to change the sort order

- go back to TB menu > Settings > Appearance > Message List and select Cards View if that's what you want
creator: siffemoz

content: This usually happens when IMAP hasn't been enabled in outlook.com webmail Settings/Mail/Forwarding and IMAP.

content: Uninstalls rarely fix problems. And often causes new ones. Check settings>privacy&security to verify that there are no remnants from the previous install. Otherwise, I am not familiar with this problem.

content: Mary far be it from me to point out that your server settings have to change when your xfinity account is migrated to Yahoo. I suggest you check if you accepted the invitation from xfinity and still have an account with Yahoo, or ingnored the notice and lost your email address. Either way you will probably need to contact xfinity.

content:
Assicurati di aver seguito questo questa -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-gmail

Ma se il problema persiste, devi contattare Google. Thunderbird non può -ovviamente- forzare il server per ottenere il token autorizzativo.
creator: @next

content: My guess is that the faulty account is an IMAP account. Try this, it might help: in Thunderbird open the Account settings tab, select "Copies & Folders" of your account, activate the radio button ◉ Other , open the drop-down menu with the list of your accounts and select "Sent" for your account (see image)
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
